add.name: add
add.definition: add(x, y, filter = false), x + y
add.description: Add all inputs (at least 2 inputs required). If filter = true, filter all input NaN to 0 before adding

densify.name: densify
densify.description: Converts a grouping field of many buckets into lesser number of only available buckets so as to make working with grouping fields computationally efficient

max.name: max
max.description: Maximum value of all inputs. At least 2 inputs are required

min.name: min
min.description: Minimum value of all inputs. At least 2 inputs are required

multiply.name: multiply
multiply.description: Multiply all inputs. At least 2 inputs are required. Filter sets the NaN values to 1

sign.name: sign
sign.description: if input > 0, return 1; if input < 0, return -1; if input = 0, return 0; if input = NaN, return NaN;

signed_power.name: signed_power
signed_power.description: x raised to the power of y such that final result preserves sign of x

subtract.name: subtract
subtract.description: x-y. If filter = true, filter all input NaN to 0 before subtracting

log.name: log
log.description: Natural logarithm. For example: Log(high/low) uses natural logarithm of high/low ratio as stock weights.

arc_tan.name: arc_tan
arc_tan.description: This operator does inverse tangent of input

fraction.name: fraction
fraction.description: This operator removes the whole number part and returns the remaining fraction part with sign

log_diff.name: log_diff
log_diff.description: Returns log(current value of input or x[t] ) - log(previous value of input or x[t-1])

nan_mask.name: nan_mask
nan_mask.description: replace input with NAN if input's corresponding mask value or the second input here, is negative

nan_out.name: nan_out
nan_out.description: If x < lower or x > upper return NaN, else return x. At least one of "lower", "upper" is required

pasteurize.name: pasteurize
pasteurize.description: Set to NaN if x is INF or if the underlying instrument is not in the Alpha universe. This operator may help reduce outliers.

purify.name: purify
purify.description: Clear infinities (+inf, -inf) by replacing with NaN

replace.name: replace
replace.description: Replace target values in input with destination values

round_down.name: round_down
round_down.description: Round input to greatest multiple of f less than input;

s_log_1p.name: s_log_1p
s_log_1p.description: Confine function to a shorter range using logarithm such that higher input remains higher and negative input remains negative as an output of resulting function and -1 or 1 is an asymptotic value

to_nan.name: to_nan
to_nan.description: Convert value to NaN or NaN to value if reverse=true

and.name: and
and.description: Logical AND operator, returns true if both operands are true and returns false otherwise

equal.name: equal
equal.description: Returns true if both inputs are same and returns false otherwise

greater.name: greater
greater.description: Logic comparison operators to compares two inputs

greater_equal.name: greater_equal
greater_equal.description: Returns true if input1 >= input2, return false otherwise

if_else.name: if_else
if_else.description: If input1 is true then return input2 else return input3.

less_equal.name: less_equal
less_equal.description: Returns true if input1 <= input2, return false otherwise

not.name: not
not.description: Returns the logical negation of x. If x is true (1), it returns false (0), and if input is false (0), it returns true (1).

not_equal.name: not_equal
not_equal.description: Returns true if both inputs are NOT the same and returns false otherwise

or.name: or
or.description: Logical OR operator returns true if either or both inputs are true and returns false otherwise

less.name: less
less.description: If input1 < input2 return true, else return false

is_finite.name: is_finite
is_finite.description: If (input NaN or input == INF) return 0, else return 1

is_not_finite.name: is_not_finite
is_not_finite.description: If (input NAN or input == INF) return 1 else return 0

negate.name: negate
negate.description: The result is true if the converted operand is false; the result is false if the converted operand is true

days_from_last_change.name: days_from_last_change
days_from_last_change.description: Amount of days since last change of x

hump.name: hump
hump.description: Limits amount and magnitude of changes in input (thus reducing turnover)

last_diff_value.name: last_diff_value
last_diff_value.description: Returns last x value not equal to current x value from last d days

ts_arg_max.name: ts_arg_max
ts_arg_max.description: Returns the relative index of the max value in the time series for the past d days. If the current day has the max value for the past d days, it returns 0. If previous day has the max value for the past d days, it returns 1

ts_arg_min.name: ts_arg_min
ts_arg_min.description: Returns the relative index of the min value in the time series for the past d days; If the current day has the min value for the past d days, it returns 0; If previous day has the min value for the past d days, it returns 1.

ts_av_diff.name: ts_av_diff
ts_av_diff.description: Returns x - tsmean(x, d), but deals with NaNs carefully. That is NaNs are ignored during mean computation

ts_backfill.name: ts_backfill
ts_backfill.description: Backfill is the process of replacing the NAN or 0 values by a meaningful value (i.e., a first non-NaN value)

ts_delay.name: ts_delay
ts_delay.description: Returns x value d days ago

ts_mean.name: ts_mean
ts_mean.description: Returns average value of x for the past d days.

ts_quantile.name: ts_quantile
ts_quantile.description: It calculates ts_rank and apply to its value an inverse cumulative density function from driver distribution. Possible values of driver (optional ) are "gaussian", "uniform", "cauchy" distribution where "gaussian" is the default.

ts_rank.name: ts_rank
ts_rank.description: Rank the values of x for each instrument over the past d days, then return the rank of the current value + constant. If not specified, by default, constant = 0.

ts_scale.name: ts_scale
ts_scale.description: Returns (x - ts_min(x, d)) / (ts_max(x, d) - ts_min(x, d)) + constant. This operator is similar to scale down operator but acts in time series space

ts_std_dev.name: ts_std_dev
ts_std_dev.description: Returns standard deviation of x for the past d days

ts_sum.name: ts_sum
ts_sum.description: Sum values of x for the past d days.

ts_zscore.name: ts_zscore
ts_zscore.description: Z-score is a numerical measurement that describes a value's relationship to the mean of a group of values. Z-score is measured in terms of standard deviations from the mean: (x - tsmean(x,d)) / tsstddev(x,d). This operator may help reduce outliers and drawdown.

kth_element.name: kth_element
kth_element.description: Returns K-th value of input by looking through lookback days. This operator can be used to backfill missing data if k=1

ts_corr.name: ts_corr
ts_corr.description: Returns correlation of x and y for the past d days

ts_count_nans.name: ts_count_nans
ts_count_nans.description: Returns the number of NaN values in x for the past d days

ts_covariance.name: ts_covariance
ts_covariance.description: Returns covariance of y and x for the past d days

ts_decay_linear.name: ts_decay_linear
ts_decay_linear.description: Returns the linear decay on x for the past d days. Dense parameter=false means operator works in sparse mode and we treat NaN as 0. In dense mode we do not.

ts_product.name: ts_product
ts_product.description: Returns product of x for the past d days

ts_regression.name: ts_regression
ts_regression.description: Returns various parameters related to regression function

hump_decay.name: hump_decay
hump_decay.description: This operator helps to ignore the values that changed too little corresponding to previous ones

inst_tvr.name: inst_tvr
inst_tvr.description: Total trading value / Total holding value in the past d days

jump_decay.name: jump_decay
jump_decay.description: If there is a huge jump in current data compare to previous one

ts_co_kurtosis.name: ts_co_kurtosis
ts_co_kurtosis.description: Returns cokurtosis of y and x for the past d days

ts_co_skewness.name: ts_co_skewness
ts_co_skewness.description: Returns coskewness of y and x for the past d days

ts_decay_exp_window.name: ts_decay_exp_window
ts_decay_exp_window.description: Returns exponential decay of x with smoothing factor for the past d days

ts_delta_limit.name: ts_delta_limit
ts_delta_limit.description: Limit the change in the Alpha position x between dates to a specified fraction of y. The "limit_volume" can be in the range of 0 to 1. Also, please be aware of the scaling for x and y. Besides setting y as adv20 or volume related data, you can also set y as a constant.

ts_entropy.name: ts_entropy
ts_entropy.description: For each instrument, we collect values of input in the past d days and calculate the probability distribution then the information entropy via a histogram as a result

ts_ir.name: ts_ir
ts_ir.description: Return information ratio ts_mean(x, d) / ts_std_dev(x, d)

ts_kurtosis.name: ts_kurtosis
ts_kurtosis.description: Returns kurtosis of x for the last d days

ts_max.name: ts_max
ts_max.description: Returns max value of x for the past d days

ts_median.name: ts_median
ts_median.description: Returns median value of x for the past d days

ts_min.name: ts_min
ts_min.description: Returns min value of x for the past d days

ts_min_max_cps.name: ts_min_max_cps
ts_min_max_cps.description: Returns (ts_min(x, d) + ts_max(x, d)) - f * x. If not specified, by default f = 2

ts_min_max_diff.name: ts_min_max_diff
ts_min_max_diff.description: Returns x - f * (ts_min(x, d) + ts_max(x, d)). If not specified, by default f = 0.5

ts_moment.name: ts_moment
ts_moment.description: Returns K-th central moment of x for the past d days

ts_partial_corr.name: ts_partial_corr
ts_partial_corr.description: Returns partial correlation of x, y, z for the past d days

ts_percentage.name: ts_percentage
ts_percentage.description: Returns percentile value of x for the past d days

ts_poly_regression.name: ts_poly_regression
ts_poly_regression.description: Returns y - Ey, where Ey = x + x^2 + ... + x^k over d days; k must be specified as a keyword argument

ts_rank_gmean_amean_diff.name: ts_rank_gmean_amean_diff
ts_rank_gmean_amean_diff.description: Returns Geometric Mean of ts_rank(input,d) of all input - Arithmetic Mean of ts_rank(input,d) of all input. This is similar to rank_gmean_amean_diff operator but in time-series space

ts_returns.name: ts_returns
ts_returns.description: Returns the relative change in the x value

ts_skewness.name: ts_skewness
ts_skewness.description: Return skewness of x for the past d days

ts_target_tvr_delta_limit.name: ts_target_tvr_delta_limit
ts_target_tvr_delta_limit.description: Tune "ts_delta_limit" to have a turnover equal to a certain target with optimization weight range between lambda_min, lambda_max. Also, please be aware of the scaling for x and y. Besides setting y as adv20 or volume related data, you can also set y as a constant.

ts_target_tvr_hump.name: ts_target_tvr_hump
ts_target_tvr_hump.description: Tune "hump" to have a turnover equal to a certain target with optimization weight range between lambda_min, lambda_max.

ts_theilsen.name: ts_theilsen
ts_theilsen.description: Theil Sen slope estimator of inputs for the past n days.

ts_triple_corr.name: ts_triple_corr
ts_triple_corr.description: Returns triple correlation of x, y, z for the past d days

ts_vector_proj.name: ts_vector_proj
ts_vector_proj.description: Returns vector projection of x onto y in time-series space.

ts_weighted_decay.name: ts_weighted_decay
ts_weighted_decay.description: Instead of replacing today's value with yesterday's as in ts_decay(x, 1), it assigns weighted average of today's and yesterday's values with weight on today's value being k and yesterday's being (1-k)

ts_target_tvr_decay.name: ts_target_tvr_decay
ts_target_tvr_decay.description: Tune "ts_decay" to have a turnover equal to a certain target, with optimization weight range between lambda_min, lambda_max

normalize.name: normalize
normalize.description: Calculates the mean value of all valid alpha values for a certain date, then subtracts that mean from each element

quantile.name: quantile
quantile.description: Rank the raw vector, shift the ranked Alpha vector, apply distribution (gaussian, cauchy, uniform). If driver is uniform, it simply subtract each Alpha value with the mean of all Alpha values in the Alpha vector

rank.name: rank
rank.description: Ranks the input among all the instruments and returns an equally distributed number between 0.0 and 1.0. For precise sort, use the rate as 0

scale.name: scale
scale.description: Scales input to booksize. We can also scale the long positions and short positions to separate scales by mentioning additional parameters to the operator

winsorize.name: winsorize
winsorize.description: Winsorizes x to make sure that all values in x are between the lower and upper limits, which are specified as multiple of std.

zscore.name: zscore
zscore.description: Z-score is a numerical measurement that describes a value's relationship to the mean of a group of values. Z-score is measured in terms of standard deviations from the mean

multi_regression.name: multi_regression
multi_regression.definition: multi_regression(y, x1, x2,..., days=0, lag=0, solver="SVD")
multi_regression.description:
Perform multivariable regression of multiple independent variables (x1,x2,...) on a dependent variable (y) across number of days.

If days = n (n >= 0), will include past n days in the regression. Setting days = 0 indicates that we're only using today (x1, x2, ...) to predict y.

If lag = m (m >= 0), will lag (x1, x2, ...) for m days for prediction.

Options for solver: "SVD"(default), "QR", "NORMAL"

generalized_rank.name: generalized_rank
generalized_rank.description: The idea is that difference between instrument values raised to the power of m is added to the rank of instrument with bigger value and subtracted from the rank of instrument with lesser value. More details in the notes at the end of page

one_side.name: one_side
one_side.description: Shifts all instruments up or down so that the Alpha becomes long-only or short-only (if side = short), respectively.

rank_by_side.name: rank_by_side
rank_by_side.description: Ranks positive and negative input separately and scale to book. For precise sorting use rate=0

rank_gmean_amean_diff.name: rank_gmean_amean_diff
rank_gmean_amean_diff.description: Operator returns difference of geometric mean and arithmetic mean of cross sectional rank of inputs

regression_neut.name: regression_neut
regression_neut.description: Conducts the cross-sectional regression on the stocks with Y as target and X as the independent variable

regression_proj.name: regression_proj
regression_proj.description: Conducts the cross-sectional regression on the stocks with Y as target and X as the independent variable

scale_down.name: scale_down
scale_down.description: Scales all values in each day proportionately between 0 and 1 such that minimum value maps to 0 and maximum value maps to 1. Constant is the offset by which final result is subtracted

truncate.name: truncate
truncate.description: Operator truncates all values of x to maxPercent. Here, maxPercent is in decimal notation

vector_neut.name: vector_neut
vector_neut.description: For given vectors x and y, it finds a new vector x* (output) such that x* is orthogonal to y

vector_proj.name: vector_proj
vector_proj.description: Returns vector projection of x onto y.

vec_avg.name: vec_avg
vec_avg.description: Taking mean of the vector field x

vec_choose.name: vec_choose
vec_choose.description: Choosing k-th item(indexed at 0) from each vector field x

vec_count.name: vec_count
vec_count.description: Number of elements in vector field x

vec_filter.name: vec_filter
vec_filter.description: Filter vector by values, such as nan. Can filter many values at once, for example: vec_filter(vec, value="nan 0 10"). Please note the output of this VECTOR will still be vector data.

vec_ir.name: vec_ir
vec_ir.description: Information Ratio (Mean / Standard Deviation) of vector field x

vec_max.name: vec_max
vec_max.description: Maximum value form vector field x

vec_min.name: vec_min
vec_min.description: Minimum value form vector field x

vec_norm.name: vec_norm
vec_norm.description: Sum of all absolute values of vector field x

vec_powersum.name: vec_powersum
vec_powersum.description: Sum of power of vector field x

vec_range.name: vec_range
vec_range.description: Difference between maximum and minimum element in vector field x

vec_stddev.name: vec_stddev
vec_stddev.description: Standard Deviation of vector field x

bucket.name: bucket
bucket.description: Convert float values into indexes for user-specified buckets. Bucket is useful for creating group values, which can be passed to GROUP as input

trade_when.name: trade_when
trade_when.description: Used in order to change Alpha values only under a specified condition and to hold Alpha values in other cases. It also allows to close Alpha positions (assign NaN values) under a specified condition

clamp.name: clamp
clamp.definition: clamp(x, lower = 0, upper = 0, inverse = False, mask = )
clamp.description: Limits input value between lower and upper bound in inverse = false mode (which is default). Alternatively, when inverse = true, values between bounds are replaced with mask, while values outside bounds are left as is

filter.name: filter
filter.description: Used to filter the value and allows to create filters like linear or exponential decay

keep.name: keep
keep.description: This operator outputs value x when f changes and continues to do that for "period" days after f stopped changing. After "period" days since last change of f, NaN is output

left_tail.name: left_tail
left_tail.description: NaN everything greater than maximum, maximum should be constant

right_tail.name: right_tail
right_tail.description: NaN everything less than minimum, minimum should be constant

tail.name: tail
tail.description: If (x > lower AND x < upper) return newval, else return x. Lower, upper, newval should be constants

group_backfill.name: group_backfill
group_backfill.description: If a certain value for a certain date and instrument is NaN, from the set of same group instruments, calculate winsorized mean of all non-NaN values over last d days

group_mean.name: group_mean
group_mean.description: All elements in group equals to the mean

group_neutralize.name: group_neutralize
group_neutralize.description: Neutralizes Alpha against groups. These groups can be subindustry, industry, sector, country or a constant

group_rank.name: group_rank
group_rank.description: Each elements in a group is assigned the corresponding rank in this group

group_zscore.name: group_zscore
group_zscore.description: Calculates group Z-score - numerical measurement that describes a value's relationship to the mean of a group of values. Z-score is measured in terms of standard deviations from the mean. zscore = (data - mean) / stddev of x for each instrument within its group.

group_scale.name: group_scale
group_scale.description: Normalizes the values in a group to be between 0 and 1. (x - groupmin) / (groupmax - groupmin)

group_cartesian_product.name: group_cartesian_product
group_cartesian_product.description: Merge two groups into one group. If originally there are len_1 and len_2 group indices in g1 and g2, there will be len_1 * len_2 indices in the new group.

group_coalesce.name: group_coalesce
group_coalesce.description: Regroup remaining stocks based on group2 and so on if original_group does not cover all stocks in target universe

group_count.name: group_count
group_count.description: Gives the number of instruments in the same group (e.g. sector) which have valid values of x. For example, x=1 gives the number of instruments in each group (without regard for whether any particular field has valid data). This operator improves weight coverage and may help to reduce drawdown risk.

group_extra.name: group_extra
group_extra.description: Replaces NaN values by their corresponding group means.

group_max.name: group_max
group_max.description: Maximum of x for all instruments in the same group.

group_median.name: group_median
group_median.description: All elements in group equals to the median value of the group.

group_min.name: group_min
group_min.description: All elements in group equals to the min value of the group.

group_normalize.name: group_normalize
group_normalize.description: Normalizes input such that each group's absolute sum is 1

group_percentage.name: group_percentage
group_percentage.description: All elements in group equals to the value over the percentage of the group. Percentage = 0.5 means value is equal to group_median(x, group)

group_std_dev.name: group_std_dev
group_std_dev.description: All elements in group equals to the standard deviation of the group.

group_sum.name: group_sum
group_sum.description: Sum of x for all instruments in the same group.

group_vector_neut.name: group_vector_neut
group_vector_neut.description: Similar to vector_neut(x, y) but x neutralize to y for each group g which can be any classifier such as subindustry, industry, sector, etc.

group_vector_proj.name: group_vector_proj
group_vector_proj.description: Similar to vector_proj(x, y) but x projection to y for each group which can be any classifier such as subindustry, industry, sector, etc.

group_multi_regression.name: group_multi_regression
group_multi_regression.definition: group_multi_regression(y, x1, x2, ..., group, days=0, lag=0, solver="SVD")
group_multi_regression.description:
Perform multivariable regression for each data points in a group. For more information, please refer to multi_regression.

Options for solver: "SVD"(default), "QR", "NORMAL"

convert.name: convert
convert.description: Convert dollars to share or share to dollar when mode = "share2dollar". Please note that the use of the convert() operator in an Alpha Expression is considered as utilizing the pv1 dataset (Price Volume Data for Equity) since it relies on pv1 data for calculations

inst_pnl.name: inst_pnl
inst_pnl.description: Generate pnl per instruments. Please note that the use of the inst_pnl() operator in an Alpha Expression is considered as utilizing the pv1 dataset (Price Volume Data for Equity) since it relies on pv1 data for calculations.
